alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:14PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Slow-moving thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Carroll, central Jo Daviess, northeastern Delaware, north central Jackson and Dubuque Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 414 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow-moving thunderstorms along a line extending from near Luxemburg to near Hanover. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Dubuque, Galena, Asbury, Dyersville, Bellevue, Epworth, East Dubuque, Farley, Peosta, Hanover, Elizabeth, Woodbine, New Vienna, Colesburg, Holy Cross, La Motte, Menominee, Luxemburg, Rickardsville and Sherrill. Rainfall amounts of one to two inches of rain have fallen and an additional half to one inch of rain are possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
